titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1259) to amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to protect Social Security surpluses through strengthened budgetary enforcement mechanisms.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-160, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1259 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. The amendment specified in section 2 of H. Res. 186, the rule providing for consideration of the bill, shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 61.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 186.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 205 (Roll no. 162).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/24/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 1259 (budget process).
